item.title: Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP Producer Reveals How Many Costumes There Are
item.description:
Highlights

  • Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP will have 30 costumes, including new options for Juliet's hair and chainsaws.
  • Players can expect 480 different looks with the customization options available in the remaster.
  • The cult classic game's costumes include nods to American cheerleader culture and popular anime series.

Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP producer Yoshimi Yasuda has revealed the number of costumes available in the upcoming remaster, with 30 in total and over 200 different variations. Yasuda has provided fans with a number of details regarding the upcoming remaster of the cult classic comedy horror zombie hack-and-slash game. Dragami Games has stated that Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP is slated for a Summer 2024 release , meaning fans likely won't be waiting long before they get the chance to play it.

One of the reasons why Lollipop Chainsaw is a cult classic is its premise, born from the collaborative efforts of esteemed Grasshopper Manufacture game director Suda51 and Hollywood film director James Gunn. In Lollipop Chainsaw , 18-year-old cheerleader Juliet Starling sees her high school being attacked by waves of zombies. Players then use Juliet's chainsaw and combat prowess to mow down the undead, looking to save the world before her birthday celebration. While Juliet is most recognizable in her San Romero Knights cheerleader uniform, players can also wear a number of different alternate costumes. Many of these outfits will be in the remaster, according to Yasuda.

2:40
Related
Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP Producer Has Good News For Fans

The producer of the upcoming Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP remaster has some good news for fans anticipating its Summer 2024 release.

In a new tweet posted to Yasuda's account, he reveals that Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP will have a total of 30 costumes, which include the original versions and brand-new ones made for the remaster. Not only that, players will be able to change Juliet Starling's hair color and chainsaws, with four of each option. With all of these customization options, Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP will essentially have 480 different looks for Juliet Starling that players can choose between in total.

Costume Options in Lollipop Chainsaw RePOP

  • 30 Costumes (Both Original and New Costumes)
  • 4 New Hair Colors for Juliet
  • 4 New Chainsaws
  • 480 Costume Variations Total

In the original Lollipop Chainsaw , these costumes can be unlocked by purchasing them through an in-game store, which can then be worn by selecting Juliet's closet in the main menu. Many of these costumes are meant to bring out Juliet's sex appeal, with variations on other American Cheerleader costumes or costumes based on anime like High School of the Dead or Manyu Scroll .

There were also a number of DLC costumes for Lollipop Chainsaw , with one even dressing up Juliet as Ash Williams from the Evil Dead franchise , with there being 19 costumes in the original, total. Based on this, it's likely at least 12 new costumes have been made for RePOP , though it's unknown if all the costumes will return, be cut, or possibly be censored if certain ones end up being too risqué. It's too early to tell, however, so fans will need to wait until more information from Dragami Games is given about these costumes. For now, many fans are excited to see which costumes will be in the remaster.

item.title: Stardew Valley Player Shares Unexpected Good Luck Benefit Discovery
item.description:
Highlights

  • Luck impacts item loss when defeated in Stardew Valley, as evidenced by a player's experience with a Lucky Lunch.
  • Boosting luck with items like the Lucky Lunch can prevent the loss of valuable items and gold when defeated.
  • Consider storing valuable items in a chest before leaving the farm, especially on days with poor luck, to avoid losing them.

A Stardew Valley player has noticed how luck impacts a particular element of the game, and it could save other players a lot of time and trouble. While luck doesn't impact what players get out of Stardew Valley geodes , it plays several roles that can make or break a day in the game.

Stardew Valley players get their first hint that luck is important when they watch the TV on their farm for the first time. The game's fortune teller tells players what their luck will be for the day. However, a player's luck can be further modified using a variety of items, like luck-boosting food and equipment. Some players may not have expected it, but luck can make a big change in one of the most upsetting moments for Stardew Valley players.

Related
Best Weapons In Stardew Valley, Ranked

Weapons are a huge aspect of Stardew Valley, even for a farming sim, and these are the best options.

Stardew Valley player AMK_Ultra shared their realization that their luck prevented them from losing even a single item after being knocked out in the game. Generally, players will lose a variety of gold and items from their backpack after being defeated. However, this player's result screen shows that they actually lost nothing from their inventory and kept all their gold, too. According to the player, they had eaten a Lucky Lunch in Stardew Valley , which can offer a significant boost to a player's luck for the day.

Stardew Valley players were pleasantly surprised to see this particular revelation. One player noted that it's possible to lose no items if a player has inherent iridium-level luck and then boosts it further with food. Other players noted that on their lucky days, they were fortunate enough to only lose items with low value. In one case, a Stardew Valley player carrying dinosaur eggs and iridium only lost sap when they were defeated, while another only lost coal.

Protecting One's Inventory When Defeated in Stardew Valley

Boosting one's luck before heading into dangerous areas could make a difference in how many items a player loses when they die. It's also a good idea to avoid going anywhere that might pose a lethal hazard to the player's farmer when their luck for the day is inherently poor. However, Stardew Valley also added the ability to recover lost items in a recent update. Players can talk to Marlon in the Adventurer's Guild to rescue one item that was lost from their inventory. However, players have to pay sell value for the item, so if at all possible, it's preferable to not lose anything to begin with.

If a player's luck is poor and they don't have access to luck boosts, it's a good idea to tuck away any valuable items in a chest before leaving the farm. While this won't protect anything the farmer finds while they're exploring, it can at least protect established resources gathered previously.

item.title: Hellblade 2 Reportedly Received Big Visual Upgrade Since Gameplay Reveal
item.description:
Highlights

  • Hellblade 2 shows a significant graphical upgrade since its last reveal, especially in lighting and textures.
  • Ninja Theory's talent shines through in the improved visuals, hinting at even better graphics in the final release.
  • The game's hyperrealistic graphics demand high-end PC specs, with an RTX 3080 recommended and 4080 for very high settings.

A new side-by-side video comparatively shows that Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 has seen a substantial graphical upgrade since its first gameplay reveal. With its May 21 launch right around the corner, Microsoft has actively ramped up the marketing for Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 , and developer Ninja Theory is in the final stretch of polishing the game.

Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 was first revealed at the 2019 Game Awards alongside the Xbox Series X, as an in-engine showcase for both the capabilities of the then-next-generation console and Unreal Engine 5. The lifelike visuals stunned many at the time, but Ninja Theory went quiet on big trailers for two years. The studio then returned to the 2021 Game Awards to reveal a segment of Hellblade 2 gameplay , which yet again shocked viewers with its near photorealistic graphics. Ninja Theory sporadically featured the game for another two years, until it finally confirmed Hellblade 2 's release date at the 2024 Xbox Developer_Direct.

Related
Hellblade 2 May Find Itself In The Same Boat as Dragon's Dogma 2

Hellblade 2 is right around the corner, but some recent news has troubled some fans, and it could land the game in the same boat as Dragon's Dogma 2.

Leading up to its release on May 21, Hellblade 2 's marketing has started in full swing, with Xbox even releasing a Hellblade 2 dynamic background for console users. Ninja Theory has also been doing its bit to put the limelight on the game, with a new 20-minute mini-documentary on YouTube centered around protagonist Senua's psychosis, which features a clip of the same gameplay segment from the 2021 trailer. Twitter user Okami13_ uploaded a video that compares the same clip from the 2021 build with the undoubtedly more recent build from the mini-documentary, and the differences are staggering.

Hellblade 2's New Build is a Verifiable Jump in Graphics

The overall lighting improvement is immediately apparent. The darker, gloomier atmosphere, and the light from the torches reflecting off Senua's face in the beginning, are big enhancements in comparison to the graphics in the 2021 Hellblade 2 gameplay reveal . In addition to softly lighting up the area with an incredible degree of precision, the flickering of the torches can also be noticed on the cave's walls, and the orange light reflecting off Senua's headband is very realistic as well. Textures also look much sharper, and the slightly overdone chromatic aberration of the 2021 build has been toned down.

Considering Hellblade 2 's 2021 gameplay trailer was already one of the closest a game has ever gotten to true photorealism, Ninja Theory somehow improving over it in such a major way speaks to the studio's immense talent. Furthermore, the newer version is still a pre-release build, so it's entirely possible that the final release code could end up looking even better. Hellblade 2 's PC requirements are also reflective of the demands of hyperrealistic graphics, requiring an RTX 3080 to run the game at Recommended settings and a hefty 4080 to push it to Very High, but the visual showcase will no doubt be extraordinary.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Celebrates Robin Fan Letters With New Promo Code
item.description:
Highlights

  • HoYoverse releases the new promo code LOVEFROMROBIN for Honkai: Star Rail fans to redeem.
  • The promo code is valid until June 18, offering 10,000 Credits and three Firmament Notes.
  • The upcoming Version 2.3 update will provide more free Stellar Jades and new events.

HoYoverse celebrates high engagement from Honkai: Star Rail fans in the online Robin fan letter event by releasing a new promo code for all to redeem. The new promo code will be available for a limited time during Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.2, the update that serves as the culmination of the Penacony storyline.

In Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.2 , Honkai: Star Rail players saw the debut of playable five-star characters Robin and Boothill and began the final chapter of the Penacony storyline. New Dreamscapes and locations were introduced in the latest update, including the Dreamflux Reef and Penacony Grand Theater. HoYoverse's HoYoLab feature suite was also updated with tools that can help players navigate the new areas and track materials needed to ascend their characters.

Related
Honkai: Star Rail Chart Shows Four-Star Waiting List For Version 2.2

A comprehensive Honkai: Star Rail chart shows four-star characters that haven't received their own rerun banners for a long time.

On Twitter, Honkai: Star Rail developer HoYoverse confirmed that over 10,000 responses were recorded in the Robin fan letter event, and all players may now redeem a new promo code to celebrate the milestone. By redeeming the code LOVEFROMROBIN , players will receive 10,000 Credits and three Firmament Notes in their Honkai: Star Rail inbox. Twitter users may directly click the link provided by HoYoverse in order to reach the Honkai: Star Rail gift website and immediately redeem the code with their HoYoverse account. Players may also manually input the new promo code within the game by opening the protagonist's phone, accessing the Trailblazer Profile, and selecting the Redemption Code button. After redeeming the code, the rewards will be available to claim from a new mail entry in Honkai: Star Rail .

New Honkai: Star Rail Promo Code Released During Robin Fan Letter Event

  • LOVEFROMROBIN
    • Expires on Tuesday, June 18 at 23:59 UTC+8

The new promo code will be available to redeem until June 18 at 23:59 UTC+8. Like other Honkai: Star Rail promo codes , the code may only be redeemed once per account. Although Stellar Jades were not awarded this time, players may earn Stellar Jades by participating in the "Robin is Here" online event on social media. The Robin is Here event lets the Honkai: Star Rail community express their DIY skills by creating a gift for Robin and sharing it on social media platforms.

The upcoming Honkai: Star Rail Version 2.3 update will provide many opportunities for players to earn free Stellar Jades. This new update is expected to be released sometime in June with more new limited-time events, features, and playable characters. In addition, a new special program will air before the update launches, giving players a chance to redeem new codes and earn more rewards.

item.title: Stunning Zelda Master Sword Proplica Replica Goes on Sale
item.description:
Highlights

  • Master Sword Proplica replica: 41 inches long, plays sound effects and 8 music tracks from Zelda games.
  • Available for sale in Japan, costs 20,000 yen or $130.
  • Set to release in September 2024; players can import if not available in the US.

The Legend of Zelda 's Master Sword Proplica replica has received a full reveal, and with it, pre-order sales have opened. The stunning replica of the sword of legend will provide players with a Zelda collectible that not only resembles the Master Sword, but also features a number of musical tracks and sound effects from the series.

Zelda has remained an extremely popular series since its inception, and with some of its recent releases, a number of collectibles have been revealed. These have included the Zelda Figma action figures produced by Good Smile, which allow fans to recreate scenes and poses from the games due to their high level of articulation. Another collectible fans have been eagerly awaiting is the Master Sword Proplica, which was initially revealed back in November of 2023.

Related
The Legend of Zelda's Next Game Needs a Skyward Sword Approach to the Master Sword

Recent Zelda titles have stripped the Master Sword of its relevance, and the next title could remedy this by replicating Skyward Sword's approach.

Now, fans don't have much longer to wait to get their hands on the Master Sword. The Master Sword Proplica has been fully revealed, showing off the blade sheathed, unsheathed, on display, and in the hands of a person for a sense of scale. The sword from hilt to blade tip measures 41 inches, and it has been finished in pearl and metallic colors, recreating the sheen of Tears of the Kingdom 's Master Sword design as seen in-game.

In addition to serving as a visual replica, the Master Sword Proplica also comes equipped with a few different interactive features. The sword's hilt has three buttons that let the player trigger sound effects from the game. The sword will also be capable of playing eight different songs from the series, including the main themes from Skyward Sword, Breath of the Wild , and Tears of the Kingdom , the Overworld themes from the original Legend of Zelda and A Link to the Past , Hyrule Field from Link's Awakening and Ocarina of Time , and The Great Sea from Wind Waker . The sword also includes a vibration function that will respond to movement.

Legend of Zelda Master Sword Proplica Replica Details

  • 41 inches long
  • Plays sound effects and 8 music tracks from Zelda games
  • Includes removable sheath and display stand
  • Set to release in September 2024
  • Proplica costs 20,000 yen, or $130~ at the time of writing

At this time, the Master Sword Proplica is available for sale in Japan. An Amazon store link is listed for USA-based sales, but the product has yet to appear on the US site. Players should keep checking back or look into importing it from official Japanese channels.
